articles.title: Saving Grace hosts microchip clinic Saturday

articles.author: WILL GESCHKE The News-Review
articles.description: MELROSE — A portion of Melrose Road is closed for a week due to construction on the new Conn Ford Bridge, and detours are currently in place for drivers making their way into Melrose.
articles.title: Melrose Road closed for construction

articles.author: DREW WINKELMAIER The News-Review
articles.description: Roseburg High School canceled school Thursday morning as a semi-truck clipped the side of a power line on W. Corey Court resulting in a power outage for nearly 1,600 Roseburg residents and businesses along West Harvard Avenue.
articles.title: Semi-truck causes power outage along West Harvard Avenue

articles.author: SANNE GODFREY The News-Review
articles.description: ROSEBURG — Unity of Roseburg is hosting a Kirtan with Sitaram Dass as a fundraiser for Onward Roseburg at 6 p.m. Frb. 3.
articles.title: Unity of Roseburg hosts fundraiser

articles.author: SANNE GODFREY The News-Review
articles.description: MYRTLE CREEK — The Myrtle Creek ~ Tri City Area Chamber of Commerce nominations for citizen of the year are due by 5 p.m. Feb. 24.
articles.title: Citizen of the Year nominations open

articles.author: WILL GESCHKE The News-Review
articles.description: WINCHESTER — The Art Gallery at Umpqua Community College is featuring a new exhibit for the coming weeks, named “Substrata,” featuring a number of large mixed-media drawings comprised of multiple surfaces, stretching across the walls of the Whipple Fine Arts…
articles.title: New art exhibit, Substrata, open at UCC

articles.author: DREW WINKELMAIER The News-Review
articles.description: DOUGLAS COUNTY — Douglas County Commissioners voted unanimously Wednesday to approve a contract to install 158 new cameras in the Douglas County Jail and courthouse holding cells.
articles.title: Douglas County jail and courthouse to receive new surveillance cameras

articles.author: WILL GESCHKE The News-Review
articles.description: WINCHESTER — The Art Gallery at Umpqua Community College is featuring a new exhibit for the coming weeks, named "Substrata," featuring a number of large mixed-media drawings comprised of multiple surfaces, stretching across the walls of the Whipple Fine Arts…
articles.title: New art gallery, Substrata, open at UCC

articles.author: HANNAH SEIBOLD The News-Review
articles.description: Katie Williams said she felt like throwing up minutes after becoming $10,000 richer Wednesday. It was shock. Her hands shook and dried tears left an imprint on her cheeks.
articles.title: Stinky Dog Grooming wins $10,000 at Umpqua Growth Talks Pitch Night

articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: ROSEBURG — Umpqua Fisherman’s Association will host a presentation by Richard Grost of PacifiCorp at 6 p.m. Tuesday at Abby’s Pizza annex building, 1661 NE Stephens St., Roseburg.
articles.title: Hydropower presentation at UFA Tuesday meeting

articles.author: Scott Carroll The News-Review
articles.description: With area vacancy rates hovering around 1.5% and rents soaring countywide, it’s challenging to find a place to live for most people, even those with a steady income and good credit. But for young people, who may not have a…
articles.title: Peace at Home awarded transitional housing grants

articles.author: Kyle Bailey For The News-Review
articles.description: The Four Chaplains ceremony, honoring the 81st anniversary of the sinking of the USAT Dorchester, is set for Feb. 3 at Westside Christian Church, 2712 W. Harvard Ave., Roseburg.
articles.title: Four Chaplains ceremony set for Feb. 3

articles.author: HANNAH SEIBOLD The News-Review
articles.description: It takes no longer than 24 hours for someone to be medically assessed upon intake at the Douglas County Jail. The next step is determining how much, if any, withdrawal one might experience, and how to find them the right…
articles.title: Take a look inside: Douglas County Jail substance use disorder services

articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: A large, yellow ball whizzed around the room as students in the auxiliary gym at Roseburg High School bounced it off each other, and the walls, while not using any hands Tuesday morning.
articles.title: Roseburg High School offers unified PE class

articles.author: SANNE GODFREY The News-Review
articles.description: ROSEBURG — A pedestrian was transported to CHI Mercy Medical Center around 2 p.m. Sunday when she was struck by a vehicle in the 700 block of Northwest Garden Valley Boulevard.
articles.title: Woman accidentally accelerates, striking pedestrian

articles.author: BRITTANY ARNOLD The News-Review
articles.description: The third annual Family Wellness Wonderland event will be held Sunday, aiming to provide the community with an abundance of health and additional family-related resources.
articles.title: Family Wellness Wonderland brings fun and local resources together this Sunday

articles.author: SANNE GODFREY The News-Review
articles.description: ROSEBURG — A 32-year-old Roseburg man either hid or fell asleep in a closet at a business in the 500 block of Southeast Jackson Street and was locked inside when the business closed for the day Saturday.
articles.title: Man in closet, gets locked in building

articles.author: SANNE GODFREY The News-Review
articles.description: Beams for the new Conn Ford Bridge on Melrose Road are delayed due to the winter storm that hit the Pacific Northwest.
articles.title: Melrose Road bridge replacement

articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: The line to check in stretched out from under the pavilion roof as families, students, community members and a few dogs gathered Monday morning at Stewart Park in Roseburg.
articles.title: Volunteers clean up river, community parks for Martin Luther King Jr. Day

articles.author: HANNAH SEIBOLD The News-Review
articles.description: Joshua Allen has been stuck at the Seven Feather's Truck and Travel Center due to hazardous winter weather conditions striking Oregon.
articles.title: Oregon deals with winter storm, Douglas County sees less rain
